result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber L Wallace

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amber L Wallace appeared by video.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Amber L Wallace.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense requested final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 16;  IN PERSON. Court scheduled deadline to file any trial documents by 2-17-2023. Final pre-trial scheduled for February 24, 2023 at 09:30 am. Jury trial scheduled for March 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-20-2022

Defendant Amber L Wallace in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Amber L Wallace.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared in court on behalf of Patrick Franken for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea Hearing. Parties are still in negotiations and are requesting an adjournment. Court grants request. Case adjourned for a status conference date to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-13-2022

Correspondence with parties. Attorney Toran informs court that he is in trial on another matter and is unavailable for today's hearing. Case is re-scheduled for a plea hearing date on 10/14/2022 at 3:00 pm, before Br 16.
Received and Filed. Motion to Adjourn
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Defendant Amber L Wallace in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video means. Defendant needs to complete a TAD evaluation. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Amber L Wallace in court with attorney James Edgar Toran, via zoom.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel advises that they are in reciept of discovery materials and an offer from the State. Defense is further requesting a Tad evaluation be completed. State counsel is in agreement and will take it into consideration. Case adjourned for a Status Conference to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5.23.2022

Defendant Amber L Wallace in court by video with Attorney James Edgar Toran who appears in person.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision report 04-01-2022

3/27/2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Amber L Wallace in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Amber L Wallace in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amber L Wallace appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
